text: Head to the "Murmuring Woods" Grove of Epiphany and continue your adventure

title: Mission Description
content: Still reeling from recent events, I went to the Grove, hoping to investigate and record the myths of the Titans or some manner of related research. There, I unexpectedly encountered Hyacine, who was dealing with urgent matters. The task of collecting Coreflames could wait no longer, so I chose to witness Hyacine perform the Skyward Rite and gain the path to Aquila's location.

text: Meanwhile, in the Grove of Epiphany...

speaker: Hyacine
line: I'm back...

speaker: Hyacine
line: I've been trying to stay away from here since the black tide destroyed the Grove... And through that, stay away from the memories that might make me sad.

speaker: Hyacine
line: But the wind keeps pulling me back... Maybe that's the Twilight Courtyard's duty, after all.

speaker: Little Ica
line: Doot... Doot-Doot.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I know, Little Ica. I know... I too miss the days when we all studied together.

speaker: Hyacine
line: But we have an even more important mission this time round. Lord Phainon has already set the date to campaign against Aquila . Being a descendant of the Sky people, I...

speaker: Little Ica
line: Doot-Doot! Doot!

speaker: Hyacine
line: Hmm...

speaker: Hyacine
line: You're right. At least I can still afford to get lost in thought once in a while.

speaker: Hyacine
line: O ancestors, please wait for just a bit longer . The time I spent in the Grove... deserves some reminiscence.

text: Seek out a place filled with memories
(If the player attempts to leave)

speaker: Little Ica
line: Doot... Doot-Doot!

speaker: Hyacine
line: Oh. Got it. Yes, I'll focus and not run off.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Little Ica
line: Doot-Doot... Doot?

speaker: Hyacine
line: This was where Professor Anaxa gave us "the lesson."

speaker: Hyacine
line: I can still see that day in my mind...

speaker: Anaxa
line: ...And that was your last lesson in the Grove.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Now, each of you will head off on your own path. How much the Grove's teachings can help you in the real world depends on how well you can put knowledge into practice.

speaker: Anaxa
line: However, heed this warning — If you ever do anything disgraceful out there, don't ever claim you were the student of Anaxagoras, one of the Seven Sages-

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Professor Anaxa, there are still other classes scheduled on the calendar! Are you sure you didn't —

speaker: Anaxa
line: —Firstly, call me Professor Anaxagoras.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Secondly, to clarify — The "last lesson" means "the last lesson I will teach you." I will be entering seclusion from today onwards to research ancient alchemy, and all my teaching activities will be put on hold.

speaker: Phainon
line: Ah, I see. So you're saying the lessons taught by all the other teachers aren't good enough to be considered lessons?

speaker: Anaxa
line: All you do every day is wag that sharp tongue of yours — That's a credit deduction, Phainon of Aedes Elysiae!

speaker: Castorice
line: Hee...

speaker: Anaxa
line: I have nothing left to say. Next-

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...Please wait, Professor!

speaker: Hyacine
line: According to the Grove's protocols for a cohort's final class, the lecturer should take some time in that lesson to "discuss the students' post-graduation aspirations with them and guide them toward a solid path."

speaker: Hyacine
line: Surely you can't skip such a crucial step, Professor?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Tsk...

speaker: Castorice
line: The teaching assistant Miss Hyacine is truly Professor Anaxa's nemesis.

speaker: Anaxa
line: ...Ahem, fine. Since Hyacinthia insists on this... Let's go through the process.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Since some of you are so eager to speak, why don't we start with you, Phainon of Aedes Elysiae? What is your post-graduation aspiration?

speaker: Phainon
line: Me?

speaker: Phainon
line: Well... it's not exactly an aspiration, but the only thing I want to do is to protect the people I care about...

speaker: Anaxa
line: ...I see. So you want to be a "hero." How boring. Next!

speaker: Phainon
line: Uh, I didn't say...

speaker: Castorice
line: Heehee...

speaker: Anaxa
line: Castorice! You've been giggling for quite some time. How about you go next?

speaker: Castorice
line: Perhaps my answer is a bit vague and meaningless, Professor Anaxagoras, but...

speaker: Castorice
line: I hope the world can be freed from the agony of "death," so that every living being may find calming peace...

speaker: Anaxa
line: How naive. So naive that it makes me want to weep for your fairy tale.

speaker: Anaxa
line: See? This is why I don't want to follow those outdated protocols. All I get are boring answers.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Since you suggested this whole process, why don't you wrap this up, Hyacinthia? Share your "aspiration" with everyone, and let's see if yours stands out.

speaker: Hyacine
line: So it's finally my turn...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Good thing I came prepared, hehe! My aspiration is nothing less than completing the final "blank page" at the end of the heroes' epic.

speaker: Anaxa
line: ..."Blank page"?

speaker: Anaxa
line: An interesting description. Do explain, assistant.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I've read all of Amphoreus' heroic epics while studying at the Grove, and a common thread came to my attention.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Almost every epic ends with a description of the hero's achievements, but few mention how the everyday people of that time lived. No one recorded the struggles and suffering the commoners endured.

speaker: Anaxa
line: So you're saying that, instead of legendary heroes, you're more focused on commoners living on the peripheries of historical records?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Perhaps I'm influenced by my background. My ancestor, Seliose the Daythunder Knight, raised her spear against the Sky and ushered in the Flame-Chasing era that continues to this day.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Her story is told to every child descended from the Skyfolk. We have no doubts about Seliose's greatness, yet... her towering figure overshadowed every record from that entire era.

speaker: Hyacine
line: What about the Daythunder Knight's family, allies, and friends? What about the survivors and those who died in the great battles? Whenever I think about their stories by the campfire, I realize the details of those legends have been long lost... and only Seliose's name remains.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Her brilliance had become as blinding as Aquila's, lording over everything on the ground.

speaker: Hyacine
line: That's why... I'm glad that my era does not lack heroes.

speaker: Hyacine
line: All my ancestors had was a sad past, but I have a future I want to protect. Instead of becoming a hero and ushering in a golden deluge to baptize the world anew, I want to stay in the back line and save all the ordinary humans from drowning in the rising waves.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I wish not to return to the sky, but to walk among the masses on earth. I believe it's the only way for the saga of creation...

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...to include a footnote for the everyday people in its blank page.

speaker: Little Ica
line: Doot-Doot... Doot?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Ah... I'm getting embarrassed from remembering how I said all that.

speaker: Hyacine
line: But my beliefs have never changed. Now I really have a chance to stay behind the heroes' frontline and realize my dream.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Hyacine?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Dannie! What are you doing here?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I didn't expect to see you again in the Grove. Phainon mentioned you were gearing up for the campaign against Aquila. Are you here to...

speaker: Hyacine
line: You guessed it. To reach Aquila's realm in the sky, descendants of the Sky people must perform a bloodline ceremony, summon the spirits of our ancestors, and get their blessings.

speaker: Hyacine
line: That's the only way for creatures on earth to forge the rainbow bridge to the sky , and the soul of the first ancestor I want to see is here in the Grove.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The rainbow bridge is essential to retrieve the Coreflame of Aquila , but undertaking such a vital ceremony alone is far too risky.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Don't worry. I have Little Ica with me. You'll protect me, won't you?

speaker: Little Ica
line: Doot! Doot-Doot!

speaker: Hyacine
line: Good Ica~ Well, what brings you here, Dannie?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I'm collecting as many myths and research about the Titans as I can. Everything about Amphoreus is a valuable addition to our data bank when I get back to the Astral Express.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Ah... right. If all goes as planned, you and Grayie will be able to go home after this mission, won't you?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Yes, assuming we can actually break the curse about 'worlds beyond the sky'... I have a feeling it's not going to be smooth sailing.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Oh? Could it be that you, too, have some kind of hidden powers to make prophecies now?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That's not it, but... I'm starting to question how real everything is after a conversation with a member of the Council of Elders.

speaker: Little Ica
line: Doot... Doot?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Nope. I didn't understand that either, Little Ica.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Don't worry about it. There's a lot that I still don't understand.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Since we've already met up, why don't you come with me, Dannie?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I was thinking the same thing. The Grove is fraught with danger right now, and an extra pair of hands translates to extra security.

speaker: Hyacine
line: That's the dependable "Express Guard" for you. So, shall we get going?

text: Search for Ancestral Ghost

speaker: Hyacine
line: The Chroma Coffer is vibrating...

speaker: Hyacine
line: There must be memories of an ancestor nearby.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What's this...?

speaker: Hyacine
line: This is the divine object of the Sky people, the Chroma Coffer.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Our ancestors dictated that when a descendant of the Skyfolk is ready to challenge Aquila again... they must first awaken the spirits of their ancestors with the Chroma Coffer and receive their benediction.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Only after this can the chosen Skyfolk re-ascend to the heavens.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Is it to prevent those who are not qualified from pointlessly losing their lives?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Very prudent, wouldn't you say?

speaker: Hyacine
line: The soul of an ancestor slumbers here... Now, I will awaken them.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Right.

speaker: Little Ica
line: ...Doot.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I am Hyacinthia from the Twilight Courtyard, a descendant of the Sky who has inherited the duty of Flame-Chase.

speaker: Hyacine
line: The time has come to fulfill our clan's destiny. I will join the heroes of the prophecy to return to the sky and retrieve the Coreflame.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Ancestor, please bestow upon me your generous blessing...

text: Listen carefully to Hyacine talk with the ancestor.

children.speaker: Ancestral Ghost
children.line: Who... has awakened me?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: It's I, Hyacinthia, a descendant of the Sky people. I apologize for interrupting your slumber.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: You are Lord Crispus, aren't you? I've read your story in our family tree. You were a righteous judge who vindicated many who were wrongfully accused.

children.speaker: Crispus
children.line: Ah... I never imagined someone in this era would still remember my name.

children.speaker: Crispus
children.line: So, our bloodline and duty have continued to this distant age...

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Indeed it has. I have awakened you in the hope of receiving your blessing.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: For the Flame-Chase Journey is nearing its perfect conclusion, and retrieving the Coreflame of Aquila is the final challenge the heroes will face.

children.speaker: Crispus
children.line: Perfect conclusion...?

children.speaker: Crispus
children.line: Hyacinthia, you look very young... and you do not have the bearings of a warrior who can contend with a Titan.

children.speaker: Crispus
children.line: How can you convince me that this blessing will not turn into a curse, leading a child like you to your demise?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: A thousand years ago, Seliose who conquered the skies left behind legends and a will, entrusting the mission to return the Sky Titan's Coreflame to her descendants — to people like you and me.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Though I'm not a warrior, I will not turn away from the mission that has flowed through our blood for a thousand years.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: And I am not fighting alone... I have the strongest and most tenacious companions in the world.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Amphoreus is in an era brimming with heroes! The burden of retrieving Aquila's Coreflame no longer rests solely on the shoulders of the chosen Skyborn.

children.speaker: Crispus
children.line: Mmm...

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: I now wield the power of healing. I aim to mend the fissures in the sky and heal the wounds of the people.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: I desire to define the mission of the Skyfolk in my own terms... to conclude the vigil that has spanned millennia.

children.speaker: Crispus
children.line: I sense resilience in your words... not an outward resilience, but something deeper within.

children.speaker: Crispus
children.line: Receive my blessings, young Hyacinthia. May you gain wings to return to the sky via the bridge of rainbows.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Thank you for your trust, Lord Crispus. We won't let you down...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...Well done, Hyacine.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Heh... Thank you.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: My ancestors were all pretty strong-willed people. It won't be easy convincing them. I've run through these upcoming conversations in my head more times than I can count.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Looks like your efforts paid off.

text: Witness Hyacine collect blessings from afar.

children.text: Hyacine used the Chroma Coffer to summon the heroic spirit of the ancestor...
After a discussion, she obtained the first sky blessing from Magistrate Crispus.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Now, the next ancestor on the list... her spirit is said to rest in the Vortex of Genesis. A pity that the ceremony has to be performed in strict order. Shall we head back to Okhema together, Dannie?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The Vortex of Genesis, huh...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I have a suggestion.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Mmm...?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Remember how you suggested I learn the "secret arts of water" from Phagousa's priests?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I've been practicing that in my spare time and made some progress. Now, as long as I have spirit water with me, I can use those techniques to carve a path directly to the Vortex of Genesis .

speaker: Hyacine
line: Ah, I remember! I didn't expect you to keep at it this long — that's so like you, Dannie.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Compared to the currents of my home, the waters of Amphoreus are... rather untamed. Subduing the waters wasn't easy, but I've gotten the hang of it now.

speaker: Hyacine
line: That makes sense. Phagousa was always described as a fickle Titan in the myths.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Since you're offering... then let me put your skills to the test, Dannie.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The spirit water gate formed with this technique isn't as stable as a ritual basin. It'll likely only let one person through.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: And as Phagousa's priests designed it — "the entrance serves as the exit." You'll need to come back through the vortex once you've met your ancestor's spirit. Little Ica and I will be here waiting.

speaker: Little Ica
line: Doot... Doot-Doot!

speaker: Hyacine
line: Got it. I'm counting on you, Dannie!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: "...Under the raucous steps of their frenzied dance, the roar of celebration hides the world's heartbeat."

speaker: Dan Heng
line: "Spirit water, reveal the way —"

text: Head to the Vortex of Genesis

speaker: Hyacine
line: The Vortex of Genesis... unbelievable. Dannie is full of surprises.

speaker: Hyacine
line: But... This does feel way more disorienting than the ritual basin...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Wait, is Lady Tribbie here too? And who is that next to her...?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Ah. I think I know who that is.

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...Do you have to go already, Ciphy?

speaker: Tribbie
line: It's been ages since you were last in Okhema. You could've taken some time to rest, and we could've caught up...

speaker: Cipher
line: That's alright, big sister Tribbie! I've gotten used to life on the road. Staying in this bustling city actually feels off.

speaker: Cipher
line: Besides, your prized student... gave me an incredibly tough mission to handle.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Cut Snowy some slack, Ciphy. He's still so young, yet he's shouldering all the responsibilities Agy left behind...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Besides, Snowy's not the kind to ask for help lightly. Since he came to you, it means you're the best person for the job.

speaker: Cipher
line: You really spoil him, big sis Tribbie. Guess I'm past the age for someone to look after me...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Ciphy —

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Just kidding, I get it. That Deliverer boy does have a certain charisma about him. It reminds me of Aglaea in her prime.

speaker: Cipher
line: Anyway, I'm about to head out. Oh, big sis Tribbie, before I go — Got a little gift for you.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Wow, didn't expect you to be so thoughtful... What's in it?

speaker: Cipher
line: Heh... That's a part of the game too. If you want to see the full picture of what's inside, you'll have to wait until nightfall.

speaker: Tribbie
line: A gift with a mysterious twist? Seriously?

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Hmm? Looks like we have company.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lady Tribbie, and... this graceful lady must be Miss Cipher.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I'm Hyacinthia from the Twilight Courtyard. Everyone calls me Hyacine — pleased to meet you!

speaker: Cipher
line: Tsk, bright and cheery as a lamp...

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Ahem. Well, hello there, pink child. I'm Cifera from the long-fallen city-state of Dolos. As for the rest... it's all in the history books, so I don't need to repeat it here.

speaker: Cipher
line: So you're from the Twilight Courtyard? Does that mean...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Yes, I'm a descendant of the Sky people, the Chrysos Heir about to take over the authority of Sky.

speaker: Cipher
line: Well, that's... unexpected. I figured Seliose's descendant would be... I don't know. Taller? Stronger?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Don't judge a book by its cover, Ciphy. Cinny is a master of her craft. She's the most skilled and dependable physician in all of Amphoreus.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Don't worry, Lady Cipher. I may not be as strong and warlike as Lady Seliose from a thousand years ago, but I'm confident I can carry out the mission of the Skyfolk.

speaker: Cipher
line: Ahaha, all this talk about missions... you're making it sound way too serious.

speaker: Cipher
line: You've gotta look out for yourself, girl! Don't push yourself too hard. I'd hate to see that cute face all scratched up by Aquila's claws...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Ciphy, cracking jokes? Looks like you haven't forgotten what Agy said all those years ago.

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Anyway, I've got a mission to handle, so I'll get going.

speaker: Cipher
line: Good luck, Miss Hyacine. And if things get tough, just let that Deliverer take the lead!

text: Cipher uses the Coin of Whimsy's ability and teleports away from the Vortex...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Miss Cipher is in such a hurry.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Don't worry. She's always been like that... It's good to have her back in Okhema lending a hand.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Well, enough about her for now. You're here because of your mission, aren't you, Cinny?

speaker: Tribbie
line: It's the perfect opportunity for me to go and tuck Ciphy's gift away somewhere safe. The Vortex of Genesis is all yours.

text: Search for Ancestral Ghost

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...I will join the heroes of the prophecy to return to the sky and retrieve the Coreflame.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Ancestor, please bestow upon me your generous blessing...

text: Converse with the ancestor.

children.speaker: Ancestral Ghost
children.line: ...Child, what brings you before me? Could it be... you're a descendant of the Sky people?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Yes. I am Hyacinthia of the Twilight Courtyard, the successor of the Sky people's Flame-Chase duty.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: You must be General Ektra. Legend has it that during the Chrysos War, you led our people to ally with Okhema and held back the Kremnoan forces. It was your victory that earned the Sky people a place in the holy city.

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: Hyacinthia... You seem well-versed in our clan's history.

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: And this is... the Vortex of Genesis?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: It is. Look — ten stars have already been lit. The Chrysos Heirs' Flame-Chase Journey is nearing its end.

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: Are those... the Coreflames of Phagousa and Georios ?

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: Does that mean Hysilens and the Mountain Dweller successfully carried out their duty?

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: Heh... As fellow pillars of Amphoreus, who would've thought that Sky's duty could only be fulfilled after a thousand years?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: It's because Sky shelters all beneath it. If it were to shatter, the world would fall apart with it. That's why Lady Aglaea made the Coreflame of Aquila the final step in our campaign.

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: Aglaea...? Is she still on the Flame-Chase Journey after a thousand years?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: ...Unfortunately, she has recently left us. But you're right — she was indeed still guiding the Chrysos Heirs forward.

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: Incredible. That girl actually managed to endure the merciless erosion of time... and lasted for so long.

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: Answer me, Hyacinthia. Since you recognize me, you must have also read my writings, no?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Every record regarding my lineage is etched in my memory, including your words.

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: In that case, you're probably aware of the prophecy I sought from a certain Tribios.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Yes. "At the end of the rainbow bridge, the Skyfolk will mend dusk and dawn."

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: But unfortunately, no ancestor has ever been able to truly decipher its meaning.

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: I see. Yet Tribios' prophecies never fail...

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: Perhaps you'll be the one to witness its fulfillment, child. May the prophecy lead you to a gentle fate.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Thank you, Lady Ektra. Whatever fate the prophecy holds, I'll face it head-on. It's only by giving everything we have that we can truly accept any outcome with a smile... won't you agree?

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: Hah... I like you, child. I wish this conversation could go on a little longer.

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: Take my blessing, Hyacinthia. When I first saw you, I indeed had my doubts...

children.speaker: General Ektra
children.line: But your resolve has touched me. If Sky's divinity is fated to pass on... I hope it incorporates your optimism and kindness.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Your blessing is a treasure beyond measure, General. Rest well... I'll make sure your gift is put to its best use.

text: Skip this narration.

children.text: Hyacine used the Chroma Coffer to summon the heroic spirit of the ancestor...
After a discussion, she obtained the second sky blessing from General Ektra.
General Ektra revealed the prophecy once-foretold by Tribios: "At the end of the rainbow bridge, the Skyfolk will mend dusk and dawn."

speaker: Hyacine
line: General Ektra is... so different from how the records described her. She's quite a gentle person.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Alright, time to head back to the Grove... I shouldn't keep Dannie and Little Ica waiting.

text: Back to the Grove of Epiphany

speaker: Little Ica
line: Doot-Doot! Doot!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You're back. How did it go?

speaker: Hyacine
line: It went great. Your spirit water art was a huge help, Dannie.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Do you mind sharing what your ancestor's spirit said to you?

text: Hyacine recounts her conversation with General Ektra to Dan Heng...

speaker: Hyacine
line: What's wrong, Dannie?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Nothing. It sounds like everything went smoothly. It's just... I'm a bit concerned about the prophecy you mentioned.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: "At the end of the rainbow bridge, the Skyfolk will mend dusk and dawn."

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I can somehow sense a hint of... sadness in those brief words.

speaker: Hyacine
line: You've always been a bit of a sensitive soul, haven't you, Dannie? Lady Trinnon deciphers countless prophecies every day, and this one's just another among many. Don't worry too much about it.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...I hope so.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Come on, Dannie. Don't look so gloomy. We're gonna have to take a long trip for the final visit to the ancestors.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Where are we going?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Our final stop is Lord Mydei's home — Castrum Kremnos.

text: Search for Ancestral Ghost

speaker: Hyacine
line: We're here. This is it.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Castrum Kremnos...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lord Mydei has been fighting the black tide here alone day after day... I'm worried about him.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: He sent a message earlier, carried by thunder, warning us to watch out for the Flame Reaver's actions.

speaker: Hyacine
line: That means he hasn't been consumed by the black tide's madness yet.

speaker: Hyacine
line: We're here to complete an important mission... We shouldn't interfere with his battlefield. Don't you agree, Dannie?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I agree.

speaker: Hyacine
line: There — that sleeping spirit... is my grandmother.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Your... grandmother?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Yes. My grandmother Jacyntha was a warrior. She represented the Twilight Courtyard in the Kremnos Festival.

speaker: Hyacine
line: She fought her way through every challenge and reached the final stage of the Kremnos Festival. She was just one step away from securing a peace treaty for the Skyfolk, but... was ultimately defeated by the champion warrior of that time.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I've never looked too deeply into the details of such ritualistic violence. The scrolls simply described it as "a glorious duel."

speaker: Hyacine
line: But behind the glorious duel... was a tragic end. Not long after the festival, my grandmother's injuries worsened, and she passed away far from home. This Prophecy Tablet was left here by the Kremnoans to honor her final wish.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Her death marked the final collapse of the Twilight Courtyard, already fragile under the shadow of war.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: And the Kremnoan warrior she fought against...

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...was Lord Krateros.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Yet you still saved his life, even though he took your family.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Seeing him lying there, gravely wounded, bleeding out... I can't put what I felt at that moment into words.

speaker: Hyacine
line: But when I heard Lord Krateros took that fatal blow to protect Lady Trianne... All those tangled feelings faded away.

speaker: Hyacine
line: To quote Lord Phainon, Krateros must have done that "to become a better man."

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It takes true courage to forgive. You're every bit as strong as your ancestors, Hyacine.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Heh... You're getting better at this, Dannie.

speaker: Hyacine
line: In her final diary entry, my grandmother wrote that when the moment of destiny comes, a descendant of the Sky people would deliver the message of their departure to her spirit.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I wonder what she'd think... When the one awaking her turns out to be her beloved granddaughter.

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...I will join the heroes of the prophecy to return to the sky and retrieve the Coreflame.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Ancestor, please bestow upon me your generous blessing...

text: Listen carefully to Hyacine talk with her grandmother.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Is this... the world of the living?

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Wait... You... could you be...

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Grandmother, it's me, your Hyacinthia.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Hyacinthia, my little hummingbird! Why... how... Why is it you who awakened me???

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: I have never imagined this... I thought I would feel happy for all my ancestors when this day came, but now...

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: I can't even experience the joy of seeing you again!

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Do you remember that... you and Father took me to my very first Sky Rite when I was eight?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Back then, you wanted me to pick one accessory out of four: The sun crown representing nobility, the storm bracelet symbolizing strength, the ice ring embodying wisdom, and the radiant pendant signifying kindness...

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Grandmother, do you remember the one I chose?

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: You spoke an innocent little prayer, infusing a faint thread of light to that modest pendant...

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Yes, and I remember how surprised you were. In all those centuries, no other child of the Sky people had ever made the same choice I did.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Hyacinthia... There was a time when I thought you were a timid child.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: You never had much interest in swords or battle, and had no relation to that fiery determination and strength in our blood.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Yet I've told myself — that's not a bad thing. If my hummingbird could live her life in kindness and optimism, then it'd be a good thing.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: I never thought the burden of retrieving the Coreflame of Aquila would fall to you...

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Don't worry about me, Grandmother. I believe what makes someone a Skyfolk isn't just outstanding strength, but the capacity to shape the world.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: When the world cried out for a hero to challenge the gods a thousand years ago, Seliose stepped forward and began the Flame-Chasing era...

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: ...And now, as the Flame-Chase Journey nears its end, this broken world is crying out for something else — healing.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Isn't it poetic? A saga that spans a thousand years began with Sky, and will also end with Sky...

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Heh... you're still as optimistic as ever, just like when you were a kid.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: If your mind is set, Hyacinthia, then carry your resolve through to the very end.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Return to the sky with my blessing, and watch over this world on the threshold of salvation.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Grandmother... thank you, but I have one last request.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Speak, Hyacinthia. We should still have some time.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Before you go... could you tell me the tale of the sky hero once more, just like you used to?

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Hehe...

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Then, listen closely, my dearest hummingbird. After all, this will be the last time...

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: For millennia, the Titans waged relentless wars, leaving the world scarred and ravaged.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: A century of the Chrysos War plunged the nations into chaos and decay.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Until a spear, fueled by mortal rage...

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Pierced through the smoke and flames that buried the prophecy of deliverance.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Aquila, the celestial shaper, the hundred-eyed divine bird crowned with the blazing sun and wielding thunder...

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Though struck blind in ninety-nine eyes by Nikador, they kept one eye, glaring at the children of twilight who received divine blessing yet turned their weapons against the gods.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: The Chrysos Heir of the Sky, Seliose the Daythunder Knight , ascended the forbidden lands of the Eye of Twilight at dusk, clad in wings.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: To her left was the lion-headed Solabis, the Sunlit Wings, whose roars breathed divine flames and scorched the world.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: To her right was the horse-bodied Lunabis, the Moonlit Plume, whose graceful steps trampled the stars in the heavens.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: The one warrior and her two beasts challenged the ruler of the sky, determined to seize the divine Coreflame through plunder.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: The Titan's every roar summoned lightning bolts, and their every movement stirred cyclones.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: The wounded Titan's blood... poured down like boiling rain upon the world and converged into scalding torrents.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: In the final moments of the battle, the Sunlit Wings set the Titan's wings aflame, while the Moonlit Plume sealed the divine body...

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: The battered hero of the sky, with her wings broken and her body covered in wounds, struggled to lift her spear... and pierced the last monstrous eye.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: The Titan's divine body crashed to the ground, and with it, the sky tore apart like fabric, about to fall with its god.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: The fear and pleas of mortals urged the hero of the sky to rise again.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: Seliose the Daythunder Knight, the first of the Chrysos Heirs to slay a god in this world, charged into the crumbling body of Aquila with her two fearless winged companions.

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: She merged with the Titan, holding up the sky once more, only to leave behind a powerful message for the world —

children.speaker: Jacyntha
children.line: "My descendants will be blessed and cross the rainbow bridge back to the sky... At the end of the Prophecy of Genesis, they will reclaim the Coreflame from my hands."

text: Witness Hyacine collect blessings from afar.

children.text: Hyacine used the Chroma Coffer to summon the heroic spirit of the ancestor...
After a discussion, Hyacine obtained the third sky blessing from her grandmother, Jacyntha.
At the moment of parting, Grandmother told Hyacine one last time the legend of the hero of the sky — Seliose the Daythunder Knight...

text: When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret.
